preprocessed_description: Please Note: If you are a current Algonquin College employee, apply to this job via the Workday application. Department: Allied Health (Paula Benbow) Position Type: Full-Time Support Salary Range: $38.01-$44.05-Hourly Scheduled Weekly Hours: 36.25 Anticipated Start Date: February 26, 2024 Length of Contract: N/A Posting Information Support Staff employees, as defined by the full-time Support Staff Collective Agreement, will be given first consideration. Posting Closing Date: February 2, 2024 Please note: jobs are posted until 11:59 pm on the job closing date. Job Description: Under the direction of the Chair, the incumbent is responsible for the overall operation and maintenance of health and safety standards, laboratory equipment and associated software programs in Respiratory Therapy, Cardiovascular Technology and Sonography programs. The incumbent: Provides oversight for all laboratory supplies and equipment; Maintains laboratory schedules; Sets up and tears down laboratory sessions; Orients professors in usage of laboratory equipment; Collaborates with professors in respiratory therapy simulation-based learning activities; Supports technical instruction to students; Maintains equipment inventory. Duties and Responsibilities: Maintains, repairs, and provides technical advice and record of purchase/ordering of all equipment related to the Respiratory Therapy, Cardiovascular Technology and Sonography programs; Maintains and orders disposable inventory for all programs; Performs annual inventory of equipment and supplies according to established College procedures; Verifies budget and reports discrepancy to the Chair; Collaborates with faculty throughout laboratory sessions including simulation-based learning to assist students in developing required skills and competencies and in interpreting technical results and measurements; Collaborates with faculty and technologists in new simulation-based learning activities ensuring consistency across programs; Maintains orderliness and cleanliness, and co-ordinates the use of, both the laboratory and classroom facilities for the Respiratory Therapy, Cardiovascular Technology and Sonography programs, while maintaining a safe work environment as per the Occupational Health and Safety Act and other established Health and Safety Guidelines; Maintains laboratory schedules; Selects, prepares, and assembles the proper apparatus and materials for all lab sessions; Assist in Respiratory Therapy simulation scenarios and evaluating students performing the scenarios; Guides, tests, and instructs in the proper and safe use of all Respiratory Therapy, equipment, and associated simulation equipment; Demonstrates the use of new equipment; establish and conducts preventive equipment maintenance; Orients new and part-time faculty to laboratory procedures and assists them in finding equipment and resources for their courses and day-to-day functions; Performs other related duties as assigned. Required Qualifications: Minimum three (3) year Diploma in Respiratory Therapy with professional certification or equivalent as a Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT); Minimum of five (5) year experience as a Respiratory Therapist in an acute care facility, which preferably includes oversight of equipment maintenance and repairs, software applications in a laboratory setting and inventory monitoring and simulation-based learning; CPR, WHMIS and First Aid must be current throughout tenure; Excellent interpersonal skills; Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; Well-developed verbal and writing skills to effectively communicate with staff and students. This position is paid at Payband I Vacancy is for P00719 This position is subject to the terms of the Support Staff Collective Agreement: https://www.algonquincollege.com/hr/files/2019/04/2018-2022_college_support_ft.pdf Algonquin College values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We offer an inclusive work environment and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process please contact the Human Resources department at humanresources@algonquincollege.com. While we thank all those who apply, only those to be interviewed will be contacted.
